docs.snippet: The heat and humidity will be a factor, and so will the poor playing surface, when the Amazonian jungle city of Manaus hosts England and Italy in its first World Cup match on Saturday.
docs.lead_paragraph: The heat and humidity will be a factor, and so will the poor playing surface, when the Amazonian jungle city of Manaus hosts England and Italy in its first World Cup match on Saturday.

headline.main: World Cup Heads to Jungle for England vs. Italy
headline.print_headline: World Cup Heads to Jungle for England vs. Italy

docs.snippet: American referee Mark Geiger will work his first World Cup game when Colombia plays Greece on Saturday.
docs.lead_paragraph: American referee Mark Geiger will work his first World Cup game when Colombia plays Greece on Saturday.

headline.main: US Referee Mark Geiger Gets Colombia-Greece Duty
headline.print_headline: US Referee Mark Geiger Gets Colombia-Greece Duty

docs.snippet: The tactical approaches of England and Italy's wily coaches Roy Hodgson and Cesare Prandelli will come under the microscope with the oppressive atmosphere of the Amazon rainforest providing the backdrop for a Group D clash on Saturday.
docs.lead_paragraph: The tactical approaches of England and Italy's wily coaches Roy Hodgson and Cesare Prandelli will come under the microscope with the oppressive atmosphere of the Amazon rainforest providing the backdrop for a Group D clash on Saturday.

headline.main: New-Look England and Wizened Italy Face Jungle Test
headline.print_headline: New-Look England and Wizened Italy Face Jungle Test

docs.snippet: Only eight countries have ever won the World Cup, and in Brazil three of them face Group D underdog Costa Rica.
docs.lead_paragraph: Only eight countries have ever won the World Cup, and in Brazil three of them face Group D underdog Costa Rica.

docs.snippet: FIFA has confirmed that Costa Rica defender Dave Myrie can join its World Cup squad as a replacement for Heiner Mora who was injured in training this week.
docs.lead_paragraph: FIFA has confirmed that Costa Rica defender Dave Myrie can join its World Cup squad as a replacement for Heiner Mora who was injured in training this week.

headline.main: Myrie Replaces Injured Mora in Costa Rica Squad
headline.print_headline: Myrie Replaces Injured Mora in Costa Rica Squad

docs.snippet: Every year there are more festivals around Europe offering a range of music and activities, from tango to indie rock to folk with a Celtic flavor, and much more. Here are a selection highlighted by Reuters journalists.
docs.lead_paragraph: Every year there are more festivals around Europe offering a range of music and activities, from tango to indie rock to folk with a Celtic flavor, and much more. Here are a selection highlighted by Reuters journalists.

headline.main: Trip Tips: Tango, Rock, Folk on Tap at Eurofests
headline.print_headline: Trip Tips: Tango, Rock, Folk on Tap at Eurofests

docs.snippet: The Jamaican government has decided to decriminalize the possession of small amounts of marijuana, joining the trickle of countries moving to soften laws on the drug known on the Caribbean island as "ganja."
docs.lead_paragraph: The Jamaican government has decided to decriminalize the possession of small amounts of marijuana, joining the trickle of countries moving to soften laws on the drug known on the Caribbean island as "ganja."

headline.main: Jamaica to Decriminalize Personal Marijuana Possession
headline.print_headline: Jamaica to Decriminalize Personal Marijuana Possession

docs.snippet: On June 13 in World Cup history: Uruguay's Jose Batista gets fastest red card in the Mexico City suburb of Nezahualcoyotl in 1986.
docs.lead_paragraph: On June 13 in World Cup history: Uruguay's Jose Batista gets fastest red card in the Mexico City suburb of Nezahualcoyotl in 1986.

headline.main: Uruguay's Batista Shown Fastest Red Card
headline.print_headline: Uruguay's Batista Shown Fastest Red Card

docs.snippet: Unlike in soccer, saving a goal with his hand was a legal move by Rangers center Derek Stepan in the Stanley Cup finals against the Kings.
docs.lead_paragraph: Unlike in soccer, saving a goal with his hand was a legal move by Rangers center Derek Stepan in the Stanley Cup finals against the Kings.
docs.abstract: New York Rangers center Derek Stepan's gloving of puck off goal line in Game 4 of Stanley Cup finals was legal and may live on in hockey lore; he did not cover the puck with his glove as he moved it, because he knew that would give the Kings a penalty shot.

headline.main: Stepan’s Sweep (of a Glove) Helps His Team Avoid One
headline.print_headline: Stepan’s Sweep (of a Glove) Helps His Team Avoid One
